Our dream is that Waterville will be the first stop on the show’s way to Broadway and beyond, and that the art & science fair will be a template for a new way of including the arts in STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, ART & Math) Education.  Further, from every ticket sold we are donating $1.00 to the Shriners' Children's Hospital.Putting on a show and educational program like this is not cheap--especially when bringing in the kind of exceptional talent we have recruited for cast and crew. The normal funding streams (ticket sales, advertising, sponsorship, grants) may not be enough, so we are asking our friends to join us in supporting this work. We have great rewards in store for you for being part of our team, ranging from music files and DVDs to premium tickets, invitations to backstage events, meetings with cast and crew, and more.  Please take a few minutes to review which level of support feels right for you. Even if you can give only a few dollars now you can still help us by spreading the word and encouraging your friends to join the campaign or purchase tickets to the show.We are super excited about “One Way Trip to Mars,” and are pleased that so many people are expressing their interest and support. WBLM (radio 102.9) has signed on as our Media Sponsor, and the Explore Mars organization (supported by NASA, Boeing, Lockheed Martin and other major organizations involved in space exploration) is partnering with us to help ensure access to technical and financial support from the space exploration community.  Check out the wonderful article by famed music critic Bob Keyes in this week’s Maine Sunday Telegram (http://www.pressherald.com/2017/06/18/one-way-t...). We hope you will join us, too, with your financial support and attendance. With your help “One Way Trip to Mars” will have an amazing future. Please repost on social media and tell friends and family about the campaign and about the show (and for out-of-state folks, consider this: there’s no better time than the end of August to spend a few days in Maine).We look forward to hearing from you…and seeing you in Waterville! Now, please meet our cast:Fantine as CassandraPepe Nufrio as Paolo "Cruze"Cory Gibson as HectorNacole Palmer as MadeleineMaigan Kennedy (Ensemble)Marta Rymer as "Mars"Elora Von Rosch (Ensemble)Evan Michael Smith (Ensemble)David Curtis (Ensemble)Renee Gagner (Ensemble)Jackson Mattek

story:
Since Spring 2011, Cornucopia Theatre has been giving free performing arts training, projects and productions for/with young people in the London borough of Tower Hamlets including ‘What the Dickens!’ http://www.towerhamletsarts.org.uk/uploads/4042/WHAT_THE_DICKENS_POSTER.pdf Numskulls in Bow inter-generational project https://www.ourbow.com/numskulls-in-bow/  courses in mime, pantomime and circus skills plus three ‘Shakespeare on Film’ courses.Cornucopia theatre Company is proud to present it’s fifth site-specific Shakespeare production, 'Pericles' with inclusive arts workshops, raising funds for Glamis Adventure Playground.  Past productions include:  

‘The Tempest’ (2015)     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6IsY5Am89Y8

'A Midsummer Night's Dream' (2013)   https://vimeo.com/76891098

Romeo and Juliet (2012)    https://vimeo.com/54039743

Macbeth (2011)  https://vimeo.com/26201422

Cornucopia Theatre Company are experts in bringing together Shakespeare’s text and physical theatre, innovation and popular classics, spectacle and story, professionals and community. Our present show offering is 'Pericles'     https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a-tHHQaY1Ew

So many young people, families, youth centre staff, teachers and local residents have come to the show and asked us to keep giving free drama and art workshops to the community and leading towards the next Cornucopia spectacular-a travelling boat-stage taking Shakespeare-inspired stories to the audience, maybe to you!.

But we need your help to continue this invaluable work! Your contribution would help with the outstanding lights, sound and production costs of our pioneering Pericles production and the continuation and expansion of regular specialist training for young people to achieve the expertise and experience they need in their chosen field and interests. Your contribution can be financial and any amount is welcome but also you can help by putting the word out and make some noise about our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools and other social media. Please support great art, community and Glamis Adventure Playground!

PERICLES AT GLAMIS -VIDEO:  https://youtu.be/xppPouZkPuk                                           PHOTOS:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B2JZQ5RPPI4IVG...

‘Congratulations on PERICLES. I thought it was a beautifully conceived and staged production. The play suited the setting really well and the Indian transposition was great. Your singer was wonderful and the choreography bold and rather joyous.

I also thought you had achieved in your cast a remarkable standard of speaking the text, despite the really tricky acoustic - traffic, wind etc. It is a wonderful space and what a terrific enterprise for that Adventure Playground and wider community’ - Patrick Sandford, theatre director.

story:
Who am I?

Hello!

My name is RJ Magee and I am a professional actor, director, and talent manager based in Philadelphia & New York City. 

I was recently accepted into the prestigious Fellows program as part of the Eugene O'Neill Cabaret and Performance Conference, under Artistic Director John McDaniel. I have been awarded a generous 50% scholarship but I still need help offsetting the remaining tuition costs. 

What is the 'O'Neill Cabaret and Performance Conference?'

The Conference reexamines, redefines and revitalizes the Cabaret art form for the 21st century, using a definition of cabaret as “any kind of live performance in an intimate space that often breaks the fourth wall.” During its intense two-week period, this conference provides hands-on artistic guidance and instruction to a select group of participants chosen by application and invitation, featuring some of the top names in theater today.

The Fellows program is comprised of a select group of individuals who are provided with an intense course of study. With 3-hour classes daily, one in the morning and one in the afternoon, the Fellows work with some of the finest coaches and music directors in the business to prepare for public performances during the conference, and are also encouraged and expected to experiment and sing nightly at the conference’s open mic sessions. Past fellows have developed relationships that offer fruitful opportunities as they move forward through their performing careers.

Over the last six summers, the Conference has presented over 60 performances including Rock and Roll Hall of Fame’s Ronnie Spector, country recording artist Sherrie Austin, Academy Award-winner Shirley Jones, and Broadway and Cabaret favorites including Tommy Tune, Betty Buckley, Mimi Hines, Donna McKechnie, Leslie Uggams, Barb Jungr, Wesla Whitfield and Mike Greensill, Gregg Edelman, Tony Roberts, Penny Fuller, Rita Gardner, Amanda Green, Deven May, Andre DeShields and many more.

How can you help?

No donation is too small or too large! I have a long way to go before raising enough funds to attend the conference but the journey of one thousand miles begins with a single step! :)

Feel free to check out the following link if you'd like to learn more about the conference, faculty etc:

http://www.theoneill.org/summer-conferences/cab...

And for a preview of some of the material I might workshop at the conference in August, please check out my YouTube channel:

https://www.youtube.com/user/RJBroadwayBoy

All the best,

RJ Magee

story:
Who is  The New Renaissance Theatre Company, and what is The Unrehearsed Shakespeare Project?

The New Renaissance Theatre Company is a 501(c)(3) non-profit whose mission is to illuminate the joy and passion captured in the best of live theatre by connecting the classic to the contemporary through ensemble-based development and performance.

It is our goal to create an artistic home for an ensemble of actors and theatre craftsmen. It all begins with The Unrehearsed Shakespeare Project.

USP is dedicated to performing the works of William Shakespeare using the unrehearsed cue script technique in order to expose our community to unique productions that bring the audience and performers together in a way that only theatre can. The unrehearsed cue script technique is based upon the working conditions of Shakespeare's own company, our research and our experience in performing and producing plays using this historically informed practice.

 

Announcing our cast for 

The Taming of the Shrew & The Tragedie of Macbeth

Leenie Baker, Nick Benninger, Ryan Bergman, Courtney Colligan, Emma Crist, Eric Freitas, Joanna Getting, Tonya Lynn, Jamie Rafacz, Gabe Reed, Adam Rutledge, Adam Seligson, Samantha Watson

Directors: Elizabeth Ruelas, Andy Kirtland

Stage Manager: Charlene Jacka

Fight Direction: Tonya Lynn, Adam Rutledge

Notice we don't say who is playing which role. That is because our actors receive several tracks of roles for each play, and we change who performs which roles from show to show. It's always fresh for our audience and our cast!

What can we do with your money?

We are raising this $1000 to buy 2 single-handled aluminum broadsword from Rogue Steel. These are high-quality, durable weapons that we will use in this summer's The Tragedie of Macbeth. And Fortunately, as a theatre that performs a lot of classical theatre, these swords will get a lot of work in the future! Money raised above the cost of these swords will go towards buying daggers and supplies for storage and upkeep of our budding armory. Moving forward, this will help to save NRTC money on weapon rental, allowing us to spend our budget in other directions, like paying our talented actors.

What do you get out of it?

The chance to enhance our audience's experience of this unique performance technique by contributing to our armory. Some levels of giving afford you the chance to enjoy a performance in style with a reserved place and tasty treats. Other levels of giving offer the opportunity to receive cue scripts, the tools that our actors use in the preparation and performance of their roles. There is even the opportunity to have a sword named in your honor. your generosity could even sponsor a workshop for a Pittsburgh area school!

Growing and growing...

Since 2014, we have added expanded from one production to two for our summer tours. Each year has seen more performances, new venues and bigger audiences. This year, we will return to Baltimore for Artscape (the largest independent arts festival in the country) for a third time! As we grow our armory, with your help, we are continuing to expand our capacity to bring high quality, unique theatre to more people for free!

Other ways you can help:

If you are unable to donate directly to our campaign, please help us spread the word about our tour. You are our best advertising! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about this campaign. And most importantly: come out and see a performance with your friends and family!

story:
Short Summary

 

  • A passionate Director and an inspirational Playwright from opposite sides of the nation collaborate together to bring a heartfelt, important piece of theater to NYC dealing with mental illness and the hyper sexuality to the NYC Theater Festival Scene.

  •  Our one-act play is underway, rehearsing with an incredible cast that includes the ever delightful and talented Rew Starr. This show tackles issues prominent in our day and age. With a sensitivity and sensibility to the nature of the themes presented, we have protagonist, Davi (a mashup of Dymphna, the patron saint of mental illness, and King David, if he had a twin sister). She is an artist/ musician dealing with manic depression. in the height of one of her episodes, she faces being evicted, her family life crumbling, and escaping through several Craigslist conquests. Our imagery while tackling this rehearsal process is that she is on a lifeboat and as she grips tighter to the rope securing her to the ship, she feels the harsh waves crash against drifting her further as she sees the rope unraveling. Stories like this are not often told; we feel it is time that they are.

  • We seek your assistance in mounting this production, as the ability to make meaningful productions like "Maximalista" doesn't come cheap, and we cannot do it alone. your funds helps us to do a multitude of things:
  • First you make it possible to produce this show at all.  
  • pay stipends to those involved
  • rent the space to rehearse
  •  costumes
  • pops
  • set
  • crew
  • festival fee
  • scripts
  • marketing
  • sound
  • and much, much more.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our desired budget looks like this

  • Fees to the festival - $35
  • Props and costumes - $225
  • Paint for the set - $20
  • Stipend - $700
  • Audition Space - $100
  • Rehearsal Space - $450
  • Programs, flyers, and designs - $215
  • Outreach - $100
  • Makeup- $70
  • Promoting Mental Health First aid- $ 50
  • Marketing  - $500
  • Misc. - $250
    Total we are hoping to raise $2,700 to reach our Ideal budget, notice we want to use a portion to provide outreach ( as one of our characters in the show does) and raise awareness. 
  • We are aware that it is not possible to do this without you so we have developed an incentive program! Anything you donate is not only appreciated but will help tremendously. (50 people each donating $10 covers our most expensive portion of our budget, together we can reach it!)
    Contributors - $1-$99
  • Receive a shout out in our program. and a personalized thank your from our playwright Ash Sanborn
    Sponsors - $200- $500
  • The above mentioned
  • A copy of our program signed by the cast 
  • and a copy of the script signed by the Director and Playwright

         Co-Producers -$501-$999

  • the above mentioned
  • digital copy of the production

​        Associate Producers - $1000 +

  • above mentioned
  • one of the one of a kind exclusive paintings used in the show signed by the artist. ​

if perchance we do not make our goal, we will still be using the funds in a prioritized manner to make sure we can do the show!

The Impact

 

  • As a Director, I have had the honor to direct 4 new works including this one; all of the shows I have directed have received strong reviews. I always strive to find the comedy in drama and the drama in comedy. I believe life is a constant tug and pull, and I believe theater is a reflection of that. 
  • As a playwright, Ash Sanborn has a strong eye for issues in our present day that although are not in the public eye need to be. Her plays focus on the artist, mental health, addiction, and poverty. It was an honor to act in her first show in NYC and now to collaborate with her as the Director on "Maximalista."  #mentalhealthplay. 
  • As Artist, both Ash and I believe that theater can be one of the fastest ways to the heart. Money donated to this  production has value in not only the monetary sense, but also in your belief in us, our cast, and the ability to make a difference. The chance to bring these issues to the forefront and through theatre, that and the impact we know this can have, is priceless.

Risks & Challenges

  • We understand that the issues we address are not ones people like discussing. Both the subjects are taboo,but neither lacks importance and needs to be discussed. There is a risk in being insensitive when discussing the fragility of the subjects, but have take the steps to ensure that all things in this show are handled through an artistic sensibility.
  • We know the risk of producing a show. It is very costly. We will be keeping a strong social media presence, and between that and this campaign, we are committed to make this show happen. We would like to thank The Artist Co-op for being one of the first to support us in a huge way and donating a portion of our needed time in the studio to rehearse to this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute a large amount even $5 makes a difference. As artists ourselves, we do understand that even that can be a lot at times, but there are other ways to help and support us:

  • The largest way is to spread word about our campaign. 
  • be sure to take a look at the indiegogo share tools
  • donations of services are also more than appreciated, ie. taping the production. holding interview, write ups in papers, the possibility are endless.

Please watch a sneakpeak of one of our first rehearsals, Rew Starr as Davi and Alexandra Taylor as Auditioner 1 https://youtu.be/gJosRHpTCY0

story:
What We're About

 

The Minerva Collective is a female forward theatre and political collective using performance as a platform for social commentary and change.

We develop and devise work that is dedicated to the following themes;

  1. Giving voice to unheard female voices.
  2. Studying the female experience within society.
  3. Exploring the point at which women begin to feel oppression and how this might be challenged and changed through performance.
  4. Drawing together liberation groups through theatre.

We work through writing original work, devising and collecting verbatim material. 

Sacrament- About the Show

You know when you tell yourself a particular story about who you are and how you got where you are and where you’re going and then something happens and you have to tell yourself a different story to make sense of yourself to yourself?

A little girl in a first communion dress cossetted by family in Catholic Ireland dreams of the next time she will wear a white dress to Mass. But then she grows up. And as her music taste evolves, so does her relationship with God (if there is one), love (but sure what does that even mean?), and sex (but shhh don’t tell her Granny). One day, sexuality suddenly seems to threaten her relationships with her faith, her family and the future she has always imagined for herself. Sacrament is a play which examines how a new generation of Irish young people relate to their country's religious heritage and whether it is possible to reconcile religion with an empowered sense of sexuality.

Sacrament has been commissioned by Theatre Upstairs, Dublin to undertake a run in November of 2017

We are very excited to return to Ireland with a new show. Watch this space for further news!

​

What We Need

In order to bring this wonderful piece of new writing to you at Theatre Upstairs, we are reaching out to our amazing community of artists and theatre lovers across the globe to help generate the necessary funds for Sacrament. 

Your donations will help pay for our Stage Design, Marketing, Actor and Crew Fees and necessary equipment to bring you a guaranteed exciting and moving production.

  Together with your support we will make this production a huge success!

Why support this Production of Sacrament

Sacrament is brought to you by the Minerva Collective, a female forward collective.

By supporting this production, you are supporting new writing and women in theatre.

 

To find out more about The Minerva Collective and past productions, please click here:

http://www.minervatheatre.com/about-us

 

Other Ways You Can Help

* Come see the shows. We have our first preview on the 10th November

* Tell your friends about the show and our campaign. You can help us spread the word! Use that share button and tweet, Instagram or Facebook share about the campaign and show. 

* If you would like to sponsor the production or find out more about getting involved, contact our producer Emma at ema.hanley@hotmail.com
story_txt:
What We're About
 
The Minerva Collective is a female forward theatre and political collective using performance as a platform for social commentary and change.
We develop and devise work that is dedicated to the following themes;

Giving voice to unheard female voices.
Studying the female experience within society.
Exploring the point at which women begin to feel oppression and how this might be challenged and changed through performance.
Drawing together liberation groups through theatre.

We work through writing original work, devising and collecting verbatim material. 
Sacrament- About the Show
You know when you tell yourself a particular story about who you are and how you got where you are and where you’re going and then something happens and you have to tell yourself a different story to make sense of yourself to yourself?
A little girl in a first communion dress cossetted by family in Catholic Ireland dreams of the next time she will wear a white dress to Mass. But then she grows up. story:
Important to know : thanks to Indiegogo we receive all the funds raised here even if we don't make the target - but we know we will because of amazing supporters!

TO EDINBURGH!

Company of Rogues plan to stage the international premiere of Morgan Stern at the 70th Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2017.

The fringe festival will be an important step in the establishment of an emerging Australian theatre company and its creative team, as well as developing support for our future ambition to tour the production in Australia and beyond in 2018-2019.

THE PLAY

Morgan Stern is the latest work from Sydney-based AWGIE-award-winning playwright Gina Schein - an enthralling & complex monologue performed by Graeme Rhodes and directed by Goldele Rayment.

"A troubling, beautiful, uplifting ninety minutes that will leave you breathless" Lisa Thatcher.

Part ghost, part protector, and known only as The Gent. He has been assigned to the other side of the planet to minister to Morgan, a young Sydneysider living with schizophrenia in 1974. Shifting between centuries and across hemispheres, Morgan Stern is an enthralling one-man play exploring family, schizophrenia and the search for internal peace, set in a little-known corner of the universe: the human brain.

Informed by the experience of her own brother’s life, AWGIE award-winner Gina Schien has crafted a heart-warming new monologue that leaves audiences genuinely moved.

The project aims to:

  • Stage Morgan Stern at the 70th Edinburgh Fringe Festival in August 2017
  • Secure UK touring opportunities for Morgan Stern for 2018/19
  • Provide international exposure for the production & company through extensive participation in Ed.Fringe industry events.
  • Support the professional development of our artists and arts managers.

What We Need

So far we have covered 71% of our expenses!

This project isn't about profit - it's about taking Australian artists and their work to international stages. So, funds will be used to cover upfront costs including accommodation, food and transport. This funding will also cover the gap between our ticket sales and other income so we can break even.

The Impact

Social Impact

  • Morgan Stern has the power to help audiences develop a deeper understanding and compassion for those in our communities struggling to live with chronic mental illness.
  • Our presence in Edinburgh will contribute to the diversity of Australian work presented there by introducing a unique solo-theatre production that confidently deals with lived disability experiences, specifically mental health, from a contemporary Australian perspective.

Australian Theatre

  • We want to be a part of placing Australian arts at the centre of the world's largest fringe/performing arts festival, now in its 70th year. At Edinburgh Fringe in 2015, 94 Australian productions of various scale were presented with multiple award nominations attracting ongoing attention to Australian festival participants. With an excellent venue secured and the right support both at home and in the UK, Company of Rogues is ready to do just that!
  • Morgan Stern will contribute to the collective cultural expression of Australian arts at the Edinburgh Fringe (and beyond should EU and UK touring ambitions be realised as a result of the festival season)

Risks & Challenges

  • Theatre is expensive, an overseas tour even more so!!
  • Cash flow for upfront costs -  we can't access our box office takings until after our season concludes
  • Our expenses may exceed our current income - we have 2 funding applications we are yet to hear the result of which means we must proceed as if we do not get them. IF we meet our target we will break even.

REWARDS

Please note ticket rewards are only available on July 1st & 2nd. Donations made between 3rd and 7th July will be offered an alternative reward.

FOR ARTS SAKE

We have three original works from local artist Martin Yusuf. Starting at a donation of just $60, you can be rewarded with real art, for art's sake!

1. For Arts Sake 1 - Purple Flowers

2. For Arts Sake 2 - Tree of Life 2

3. For Arts Sake 3 - Tree of Life 1

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some of you would love to help but just can't afford to. Please consider sharing our campaign on social media and via email! Help us get the word out so we can take to the stage in August!

story:
70 Scenes of Halloween

The turbulent tale abandons linear narrative in favor of 70 brief scenes played out of order, resulting in a wild, dreamlike ride that blends realism with psychological surprise and humor. Partners become wolves and phantoms in this domestic drama about a marriage dying of familiarity. Their haunted home offers a weirdly comical and thought-provoking glimpse into the nature of relationships.

Theatre L'Acadie is excited to produce it's first production as a newly established Chicago theatre company! Revealing the truths of the human condition, 70 Scenes of Halloween is insightful, imaginative, and untraditional. Our show will run from October 2, 2019 - October 13, 2019, reaching a wide range of audiences. Theatre L'Acadie aspires to provide the Chicago community with the unique opportunity to engage in something new and unknown. We are three women setting out to make our dreams a reality, and for that, we need your help!

Emily, Kaitlin, and Brandii (co-founder's of Theatre L'Acadie) would like to dedicate this show in remembrance of our dear friend, Andrew Lee Vincent, the original "Jeff". 

What is Theatre L'Acadie?

Theatré L’Acadie represents the veritable melangé of talent that Louisiana holds. Reigning from various regions in Acadiana, Emily, Brandii, and Kaitlin represent the Cajun ideal of bringing people together through food, culture, and of course, art! 

Showcasing a unique and evocative visual artist every season, the group enjoys bringing together music, dance, and visual arts to leave people with a taste for something new. The group focuses on works lesser known by popular artists, and sometimes even the rejected works of the theater world. For our first production, 70 Scenes of Halloween, we hope to embody our mission: 

"How do you get people to talk about the ugly, the boring, the ordinary? our mission is to provoke thought, promote discussion, and influence change, through the power of live theatre."

Where does the money go?

As a new theatre company, our goal is to establish a strong relationship and positive reputation within the Chicago theatre community. If this campaign is successful, we will be able to do so through our production of 70 Scenes of Halloween.

Below you can see a detailed breakdown of our full production cost: 

As you can see from the chart above, our largest expense is paying the necessary fees associated with renting our rehearsal and performance space. After these costs, the majority of the money we raise will go directly to paying our artists, technicians, and designers. We firmly believe that this is what a theatrical budget should look like. Due to the countless amount of hours it takes to mount a full length professional production, paying our collaborators the amount they deserve is of the utmost importance!

A fully funded Indiegogo campaign will ensure that we are able to produce a show of high caliber and pay our artists, technicians, and designers the amount they deserve. Your contributions to 70 Scenes of Halloween will go beyond our first show; they will help Theatre L'Acadie continuously create unique performance art for years to come!

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary donations are not the only way you can support Theatre L'Acadie! Whether you are able to donate or not, here are some other ways to contribute:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • Like our Facebook page and follow us on social media*
  • Visit and share our website: www.theatrelacadie.com
  • Come see the show! 
  • If you are interested in large scale donations or sponsorships, please reach out to us directly at theatrelacadie@gmail.com

*Instragram: theatre.lacadie, Facebook: Theatre L'Acadie, Twitter: @l_acadie

Every dollar, every share, and every mention of this campaign helps! Thank you for supporting our mission with Theatre L'Acadie and contributing to the success of our first production, 70 Scenes of Halloween.

story:
What? 

The Actor's Nightmare is a striking 90-minute journey in which Tony award-winning playwright Christopher Durang explores the eccentric, toxic, hilarious, and lonely world of New York Theatre and the entertainment industry. Over the course of the piece, we meet actors, directors, writers, stage managers, stand-up comedians, and executive producers. We even meet an accountant, who really doesn't want to be here. The Actor's Nightmare is at once a celebration of show business and a touching reflection on what it means to be an artist. 

From Tennessee Williams to Euripides, tossing in a bit of Beckett, no renowned playwright is safe. Classic plays are warped and distorted - the outcome is both shocking and hilarious. We follow our company of 5 through the foibles and faux pas that feed entertainment nightmares. 

Our production features several UK PREMIERES and is in itself a WORLD PREMIERE : It is the first time that these plays have been brought together in this unique and thrilling way.

Pieces included are: Mrs Sorken; Desire, Desire, Desire;  The Actor's Nightmare; Business Lunch at the Russian Tea Room; Medea; andWoman Stand-Up. 

These works will seamlessly come together as a striking, full-length play.

As the show gathers momentum, our brilliant company will morph into different characters, changing their accent and physicality whilst playing off our phenomenal lighting, sound, and set designs. 

 

Who?

A female-led creative team of Director LYDIA PARKER and Designer ANNA DRIFTMIER

An ensemble cast featuring:

MEAGHAN MARTIN | Meaghan trained at LAMDA. She is best known for starring in the international hit films Camp Rock and Camp Rock 2. The New York Times described Meaghan as 'the high point in an excellent ensemble' for her performance as Bianca Stratford in the critically-acclaimed series 10 Things I Hate About You. She is the voice of Jessica in the hit video game Until Dawn and plays Naminé the new Kingdom Hearts 3 game, just released. This production will mark Meaghan's professional London stage debut.

 

KATE SUMPTER | Kate trained at LAMDA. She is best known for her performance as Rose in the critically-acclaimed BBC series The Little Drummer Girl, opposite Florence Pugh and Alexander Skaarsgard.

 

STEFAN MENAUL | Stefan trained at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama. Soon after graduating, Stefan went straight into the hit West End production of Dirty Dancing at the Picadilly Theatre. He has since appeared at the Southwark Playhouse, Theatre 503, Jermyn Street Theatre, and in the TV show Berlin Station for Paramount Television. 

Further casting TBA.

Where?

Our production will be on at the Park 90 in Finsbury Park, London.

                   

The Park Theatre is a world-class London theatre located just 4 minutes walk from Finsbury Park Tube Station which is an 11- minute hop from Oxford Circus in the West End. Founded in 2013 by Artistic Director Jez Bond and Creative Director Melli Marie, the Park Theatre has made a hugely important mark on the London theatre scene. Proclaimed to be ‘a neighbourhood theatre with a global ambition’. It has boasted several West End transfers and many productions in this venue have gone on to win multiple Off-West End awards and embark on UK tours or transfers. 

The Park 90 is the theatre’s studio space. It is an intimate, flexible and extremely well-equipped, state of the art playing space and auditorium. This venue is perfect for bringing to life The Actor’s Nightmare. Audience members can relax in the high quality, comfortable venue with a drink-in-hand ready to immerse themselves in our surreal world.

When?

We begin rehearsals the 24th of June and the play runs the 16th of July - 10th of August for 31 performances. Press night is on July 19th. 

 

3 hearts canvas: a new theatre company with a strong ethos

 

 

3 hearts canvas is an exciting new theatre company. Founded in January 2019 by Meaghan Martin and Oli Higginson, we are passionate about engaging audiences in fresh & innovative ways that challenge the way we experience theatre. We hope to bridge the gap between playwright and audience. http://www.3heartscanvas.com

Every production we mount is paired with a charity! 

We want theatre that is relevant and vitally important. Theatre that changes people and helps communities. Theatre that stays in the hearts and minds of audiences long after the lights go down. 

Theatre can be a powerful force for positive change. We want to honour the origins of theatre as a central part of society and community. 

We are proud to say that 10% of all funds raised through this page will be donated to the NATIONAL AUTISTIC SOCIETY, the UK's largest provider of specialist autism services brining passion and expertise to the lives of 100,000 autistic people each year.

                   Please vist http://www.autism.org.uk 

We are excited to be hosting a Relaxed performance on Saturday 27 July at 3.15pm at a reduced ticket price of £10.

We will also be hosting a Dementia-Friendly performance on Monday 22 July at 3.15pm, also at a reduced ticket price of £10. Elderly care and support is something 3 hearts canvas is also very passionate about, and we regularly work with brilliant charity Age UK: http://www.ageuk.org.uk

 

£ 'Money Honey' - Tell me, where does my money go?

 

  • 10% of all the funds raised through this page will be donated to the NATIONAL AUTISTIC SOCIETY
  • Your generous donation will help directly fund this exciting new project.

Here are some examples of how your money will help:

  •  £10 covers 100 flyers to make sure we reach audiences far and wide and pack our theatre to the rafters!
  •  £50 creates a stunning costume for our intriguing characters.
  •  £100 covers two days in our rehearsal space!
  •  £500 covers the photoshoot that led us to our gorgeous poster design.

For more details on our budgeting, please freel free contact us at 3heartscanvas@gmail.com

In order to preserve our ethos of keeping theatre affordable, accessible, and relevant whilst treating our artists and collaborators fairly and ethically, we need your support. Every donation is meaningful and makes a real difference in the way we can create and curate art, enabling enduring engagements with communities and audiences.

We are proud to say that we are an EQUITY partnered production, and will be following Equity standards, using Equity contracts, and maintaining an Equity Safe Space. 

 

We hope that you have a real flavour of this unique and exciting new production: The Actor's Nightmare, and that you feel like you understand what 3 hearts canvas is all about.  If you have any questions, ideas, or thoughts please do not hesitate to get in touch with Meaghan and Oli at 3heartscanvas@gmail.com or through our website: http://www.3heartscanvas.com

It is our pleasure to share our work with you.

 

Thank you for your time and we can't wait for you to be a part of this exciting journey! 

 

If you would like to support us anonymously, you can do so through this page or get in touch with our Head of Funding and Investments, Ben Wilberforce-Ritchie at bwilberforceritchie@gmail.com

 

Visit The Park Website and BUY A TICKET TO THE SHOW! 

https://www.parktheatre.co.uk/whats-on/the-actors-nightmare/cast

We are excited to be hosting a Relaxed performance on Saturday 27 July at 3.15pm at a reduced ticket price of £10.
We will also be hosting a Dementia-Friendly performance on Monday 22 July at 3.15pm, also at a reduced ticket price of £10. Elderly care and support is something 3 hearts canvas is also very passionate about, and we regularly work with brilliant charity Age UK: http://www.ageuk.org.uk
 

£ 'Money Honey' - Tell me, where does my money go?
 


10% of all the funds raised through this page will be donated to the NATIONAL AUTISTIC SOCIETY

Your generous donation will help directly fund this exciting new project.

Here are some examples of how your money will help:


 £10 covers 100 flyers to make sure we reach audiences far and wide and pack our theatre to the rafters!
 £50 creates a stunning costume for our intriguing characters.

 £100 covers two days in our rehearsal space!

 £500 covers the photoshoot that led us to our gorgeous poster design.


For more details on our budgeting, please freel free contact us at 3heartscanvas@gmail.com
In order to preserve our ethos of keeping theatre affordable, accessible, and relevant whilst treating our artists and collaborators fairly and ethically, we need your support. Every donation is meaningful and makes a real difference in the way we can create and curate art, enabling enduring engagements with communities and audiences.
We are proud to say that we are an EQUITY partnered production, and will be following Equity standards, using Equity contracts, and maintaining an Equity Safe Space. 
 
We hope that you have a real flavour of this unique and exciting new production: The Actor's Nightmare, and that you feel like you understand what 3 hearts canvas is all about.  If you have any questions, ideas, or thoughts please do not hesitate to get in touch with Meaghan and Oli at 3heartscanvas@gmail.com or through our website: http://www.3heartscanvas.com
It is our pleasure to share our work with you.
 
Thank you for your time and we can't wait for you to be a part of this exciting journey! 
 
If you would like to support us anonymously, you can do so through this page or get in touch with our Head of Funding and Investments, Ben Wilberforce-Ritchie at bwilberforceritchie@gmail.com
 
Visit The Park Website and BUY A TICKET TO THE SHOW! 
https://www.parktheatre.co.uk/whats-on/the-actors-nightmare/cast

story:
Short Summary

We are "Social Speakers", a theater group formed by theater students. Our goal is to support those in need by collecting funds by exhibiting Plays in local theaters. 

Our first play would be, " Rupa & Krishna", a play that depicts the story of Rupa and krishna. 
Krishna Oli, A civil engineer, lost his two hands and a feet in a electric shock accident.
His wife, Rupa,  has been taking care of him since the day and she is collecting funds to install artificial hands and feet so that Krishna can get back to his regular work.

We, "Social Speakers", aim to raise funds through this play and also spread message that love and support can help a disabled keep faith in themselves and get back to their regular life and that disability is temporary and providing will power is the first key to curing all disabilities. 

This play would cost us around USD 2,000 , for expenses on headings like theater hiring cost, actors, set designs, promotional activities and ticket prints. 
The USD 2,000 investment will yield more than USD 10,000 and also those who visit to watch the play will get to know them closer and also donate any amount they wish through the donation box placed at the venue.

Thanks for your Support.

story:
I am thrilled to announce that we've been selected to perform in The Detroit Dance City Festival and that we will be touring our latest creation, THE END IS HERE and that’s ok., through Milwaukee in October! Along with sharing rep works, I will be premiering a new work for the coMISSION artist-in-residency at Links Hall, Chicago. 

It's a very exciting time for KADT. However, as you may know, creative costs can really add up without adequate funding. We are hoping that with your support, we can dodge some of these hurdles and continue to share the joy of art making. 

All donations collected from this campaign will award the cast with performance stipends, contribute to housing and meals on the road and alleviate any other performance related costs for the season that arrive. Any contribution, big or small, will make a HUGE impact. 

The past five years have been very rewarding for KADT. We have gained some serious momentum. We've had full houses, great reviews and generous audiences. It's been a fun ride, but a hard one. Sustaining in this field is difficult...but the struggle is absolutely worth it. We continue to do this... because we know it is necessary. It isn't an easy route...so, we won't quit. We love making art and we love bringing it to you.

So, let's keep moving.

-Kelly Anderson

 

All photos are credited to Matthew Gregory Hollis
